data.title: Miller HIgh Life, can vs bottle
data.meta_description: Miller HIgh Life, can vs bottle
data.text:
Reid

beers 3546 º places 95 º 14:15 Tue 7/18/2006

Originally posted by HogTownHarry

I am thinking it might be attributable to a misguided nostalgia for an early positive experience with said bottles. Although I’d have to speculate that it wasn’t the contents of the bottles that made the experience positive ...

On a similar but completely different note, I once had fond memories of MGD - I drank tons of it when it first came on the market while traveling in Florida watching spring training - never went back to it until I decided to rate a bottle last year. They’re right. You can’t (shouldn’t) go back.

Remember how, in retrospect, things like - say - the 70’s start to seem cool? That’s selective memory, baby - the 70s blew chunks. So does Miller.

I think you need therapy, dude.

LOL I KNOW I need therapy..amd MHL is the least of my worries

But you speak a note of truth..when I first immigrated to the USA it was to Georgia, just south of ATlanta. That area was full of Miller High Life drinking people..and at the time reaching for a bottle of High Life straight from the ice bucket ( even though they had it in regular long necks then) was an almost magical expierience.

But still I had the cans down their too and found them lacking.

YEEEEEEEEEEE HAW !!

Reid

beers 3546 º places 95 º 14:53 Tue 7/18/2006

Originally posted by ross

I drink at least 6 highlifes a week (on saturday) usually from the can. cans get colder (it seems) and i actually think it tastes better in the can than in the bottle.

weird..I am thinkin i have some positive reinforcement of the bottles or it IS different breweries in different parts of the country.

But i never had that problem with Bud..its crap everywhere in every form.
